ratings.comment: Josh rocks. He knows everything about everything in Real Estate, and dont bother buying the textbook. Every test question is from his slides. He won't make time out of class/can sometimes have a petty question or two on tests but not bad for a 300 point exam. Pretty funny and makes it interesting, highly recommend for a great "into to RE"

Joshua made a topic that could be boring, quite interesting. He was engaged in the class and made it fun to go to lectures. It is highly recommended to attend the lectures, as a lot of the material on the exams is covered in lectures.
Josh was a good professor but could be dry at times. The material itself gets more interesting as the semester goes on. Overall, a pretty solid professor. No huge positives or negatives, honestly.

Jeffers lectures are read off poorly organized slides, he neglects to teach the mathematical concepts in lecture despite weighting them heavily on the exam. Be prepared to learn independently. The course is barely curved at the higher end of the distribution. Overall, Jeffers made the course harder than it had to be.

Josh brings tons of professional experience to the classroom. He usually keeps things interesting but lecture can get a bit dry. The textbook is helpful when preparing for tests (the second test is a rough one). Overall, he's definitely a good professor with some solid stories.

Joshua Jeffers makes me want to become a Real Estate Developer. He makes super boring topics insanely interesting. One lecture he talked about Zoning laws and had everyone on the edge of their seat. His real world experience is key. I wish I would've studied more for the tests. The math is hard so see your TA and make sure you have it down to a T
Josh is a real estate developer in Milwaukee who brings a real world perspective to the course. Awesome teacher at UW.

Currently only professor for RE 306, so don't have any other options. We were his first class he ever taught, and he was very dry. Extremely knowledgable in the field of real estate, but didn't exactly make it fun to learn, was more just memorization. Definitely need to read the textbook. I expect he'll improve as he gets more experience.

Very knowledgable professor. The math involved is definitely harder than just the reading/lecture material and the tests are very hard for that purpose. Good curves on the tests. His topic guidelines that he gives out a week before the test are really helpful in knowing what to study.

Josh seems like a knowledgeable expert in his field, but he doesn't convey interest in the material. He drops topics like a ton of books and expects you to see the importance without connecting topics. Not a bad class, an interesting foray into Real Estate for the General Business or Economics student.
